intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium jurassiciforme subsp. walfagehrense, commonly known as the Jurassic-shaped hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and exhibits a rosette growth pattern with basal leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the genus Hieracium. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral structure, reflecting adaptations to its specific ecological niche.
